title: 112_s1983
content: The Act titled "Fairness for High-Skilled Immigrants Act of 2011" imposes a numerical limitation on visas from any single foreign state. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to make changes to visa allocation and numerical limitations for foreign states. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to establish special rules for countries exceeding visa limitations, ensuring equal allocation of visa numbers among different categories. The Chinese Student Protection Act of 1992 is amended to change subsections and effective dates. Transition rules for employment-based immigrants are outlined for fiscal year 2012 and subsequent years. For fiscal years 2013 and 2014, a percentage of immigrant visas under certain paragraphs will be allotted to natives of states not among the top two with the highest visa numbers in previous years. For fiscal year 2014, 10 percent of immigrant visas will be allotted to natives of states not among the top two with the highest visa numbers in previous years. Per-country visa levels restrict the number of visas for any single foreign state or dependent area to 25 percent or 2 percent of the total. For fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014, up to 85 percent of unreserved immigrant visas under certain sections of the Act shall be allotted to natives of any single foreign state. If the application of certain paragraphs would prevent the issuance of immigrant visas, they may be issued in the following years. For fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014, up to 85 percent of unreserved immigrant visas under certain sections of the Act shall be allotted to natives of any single foreign state. If the application of certain paragraphs would prevent the issuance of immigrant visas, they may be issued in the following years without regard to specific rules for chargeability. E-Visa reform is addressed in Section 3. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include provisions for nationals of the Republic of Ireland and temporary admission for nonimmigrant visa applicants. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allow for temporary admission of nonimmigrant visa applicants based on recommendations by the Secretary of State or consular officer, or through a nonimmigrant visa under specific conditions. The Immigration and Nationality Act allows for temporary admission of nonimmigrant visa applicants under specific conditions, including those who violated certain sections before 2011. The Secretary of Homeland Security has discretion to admit such individuals and may impose necessary conditions, such as requiring bonds. The Immigration and Nationality Act allows for temporary admission of nonimmigrant visa applicants under specific conditions, including the exaction of necessary bonds to regulate the admission of inadmissible aliens. Additionally, a numerical limitation is imposed for each nationality identified under section 101(a)(15)(E)(iii).
